intro: Juncago palustris, commonly known as marsh rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments. It typically grows in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. The plant has tall, slender, grass-like stems that are usually green or reddish in color. Its leaves are narrow and strap-like, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters near the base of the stems. Juncago palustris plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
